Dbd is better now than it was before, when Stroob put the review the game has gotten a lot better, the devs are listening to the community a lot more, a dating sim is coming out for some reason..? and over all it just better, after the stale period of the game (2019) they've broughten a lot more things to the game, and adding more stuff over time, and reworking a shit ton of different things. resident evil, The Ringu, and so many others. have improved the game, and overall went from a 7/10 for me to now a 8-9/10 from me. (please remove the Twins and Plague, they're boring as shit.)

The community is usually very toxic on both sides coming into this game (end-game chat). There are always diamonds in the rough that will be good sports that you dream to face win or loss. Overall the game is fun on either side. Granted I think killer is the harder side when meta is used by more than 75% of the community. Either way, if you can tough it out, the game gets fun once you get used to looping and tracking. At the end of the day, it is a game and there is fun to be had (four friend swf on survivor is probably your best bet for fun win or loss). And no matter if you slug, tunnel, camp, hit on hook, teabag, or flashlight flick the game is in all good fun as long as no personal insults are said, everyone is just trying to win and have fun in there own way so don't take it personally.

I think that 101 hours in this game makes me somewhat qualified to review, so that I shall! DbD is a fun game, albeit absolutely horrifying, and it has an amazing community with constant content being produced, be it from the devs, or the YouTubers and streamers! I'm getting side tracked. DbD is a very worthwhile investment, if you're willing to learn about the ever-changing meta, memorizing perk combos and bonuses, items and add-ons, which killers take skill to play and which killers will carry you with meta, the list goes on and on. I took a lot of time to find what perks I wanted to run, along with which killer I wanted to main, and I'm happy with myself. But, you don't have to take 8+ hours of research to get enjoyment from this game! Play however the hell you want! Just don't be toxic and you won't get bullied in post-game chat!

best survivor: ash j williams (followed by jake Park in biker gear)
best killer: dredge )he's very fun to play)

worst survivor: meg. everybody hates meg. (see Family Guy on Disney+ for details)
worst killer: idk the only cool killer is Dredge so i cant make a judgement, though Demogorgon is probably objectively the worst just by how few matches people play him in.

Fun game that is easy to learn yet hard to master.  Pretty brutal for the weak willed yet highly satisfying.  I would consider this game more of a combat puzzle with experience granting you the understanding of each of the pieces.  DLC is a little bit obnoxious in how its hard to unlock some perks for killers that cost money.  Overall it is a fun game and not pay to win in any way
Been playing this game since I started gaming and its still one of my favorite games, if you love spooky slightly unsettling games for sure think about getting this game.

ive honestly always loved dbd since i started playing it id reccomend it to anyone who wants to platy and is a newbie to horror and wants to get used to matches and sometijes some spooky jumpscares, sometimes youll get the best and the worst from solo que team mates but overall ive made some wonderful friends from dbd and know at times it can be a great and fun community. i highly recomend this game to anyone looking for some fun and spooky competition!

When I play survivor, I watch bars slowly fill for eons while some cretin runs me down and, unless I play like an absolute degenerate and run the killer in circles around the same open window 8,000 times in a row, there's not much I can do.

Let me be real for a sec, the game sucks, it's terrible, plays like *ss and I don't know why Otz quit Souls like games to play this garbage. 

Most of the gameplay as a survivor is watching loading bars fill: the videogame, and the interactions with the killer while fun and engaging can be cheesed by many stupid toxic perks that are a pain in the *ss to deal as a Killer not to mention the items with add-ons being as annoying and broken as they are.

Killer gameplay is basically: Search and Destroy, You hunt down survivors one by one, while also sabotaging their progress on the generators so they can't open the gates and scape, i'd say that Killers are x999 times more fun to play than the virgin survivors, because at least You get to actually play an actual videogame and not 'Loading Bars' the game.

The problem is that unless You play meta killers with meta perks at high ranks the survivors will pretty much pull an UNO Reverse card and start bullying You everysingle match with their top tier items w/add ons and meta slave perks.

One more thing: The whole game is clunky as hell, the system to unlock perks should have received a complete overhaul YEARS AGO, because it's slow, confusing, and it's pure RNG. Newcomers to this game have to either look up guides on how these systems work, or ask their friends for an extensive explanation.

Why on earth, don't You unlock perks, items and all that, in an automated, more accessible way? Why on earth do I have to prestige just to have a possibility of getting the perks I want!?!?!? Not to mention that I could lose perks that could potentially benefit me in some matches? WHAT a hole load of h*rse sh*t.

And at last but not least, the community of this game is pure dog p**p. It's full of tryhards, hackers, trolls and overall degenerates that have nothing to do with their lives other than to play Dbd just to screw with others. The amount of cheaters that I've played against is insane, and the cherry of the top is that this joke of a game has a pro scene.

Yikes, avoid this game.
Good game Great fun with friends, The only thing is the 7 360's you can do with one swipe of the mouse (go in the docs to fix it!)
